intro: Carex flavella, commonly known as the yellow sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Carex flavella thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
